lines.line: Hello there. What is this place?
Do not waste my time with trivial questions. I am the Great Kolodion, master of battle magic. I have an arena to run.
Can I enter?
Hah! A wizard of your level? Don't be absurd.
You're not allowed in there. Come downstairs if you want to enter my arena.
I am the great Kolodion, master of battle magic, and this is my battle arena. Top wizards travel from all over Gielinor to fight here.
Can I fight here?
My arena is open to any high level wizard, but this is no game. Many wizards fall in this arena, never to rise again. The strongest mages have been destroyed.
If you're sure you want in?
Yes indeedy.
Good, good. You have a healthy sense of competition.
Remember, traveller - in my arena, hand-to-hand combat is useless. Your strength will diminish as you enter the arena, but the spells you can learn are amongst the most powerful in all of Gielinor.
Before I can accept you in, we must duel.
Okay, let's fight.
I must first check that you are up to scratch.
You don't need to worry about that.
Not just any magician can enter - only the most powerful and most feared. Before you can use the power of this arena, you must prove yourself against me.
No thanks.
No I don't.
Your loss.
What's the point of that?
We learn how to use our magic to its fullest and how to channel the forces of the cosmos into our world...
But mainly, I just like blasting people into dust.
That's barbaric!
Nope, it's magic. But I know what you mean. So do you want to join us?
Well done, young adventurer; you truly are a worthy battle mage.
What now?
Step into the magic pool. It will take you to a chamber. There, you must decide which god you will represent in the arena.
Thanks, Kolodion.
That's what I'm here for.
Hello, Kolodion.
Hello, young mage. You're a tough one.
Hello my friend, Kolodion sent me down.
Sssshhh... the gods are talking. I can hear their whispers.
Can you hear them adventurer, they're calling you.
Erm... ok!
Go chant at the statue of the god you most wish to represent in this world, you will be rewarded.
Once you are done, come back to me. I shall supply you with a mage staff ready for battle.
Hi.
Hello adventurer, have you made your choice?
I have.
Good, good, I hope you have chosen well. Have you been rewarded with a cape from your chosen god?
I'm afraid I don't have it with me.
Once you have your cape come back to me, and I shall supply you with a mage staff ready for battle.
Good, good, I hope you have chosen well. I will now present you with a magic staff. This, along with the cape awarded to you by your chosen god, are all the weapons and armour you will need here.
Hey there, how are you? Are you enjoying the bloodshed?
I think I've had enough for now.
A shame. You're a good battle mage. I hope to see you soon.
How can I use my new spells outside of the arena?
Experience, my friend, experience. Once you've used the spell enough times in the arena, you'll be able to use them in the rest of Gielinor.
Good stuff.
Not so good for the citizens; they won't stand a chance.
How am I doing so far?
You still need to train with the strike spell inside the arena before you can use it outside.
You have completed over half of the training needed to use the strike spell outside of the arena.
You are almost ready to use the strike spell outside of the arena.
You're experienced enough to use the strike spell anywhere.
You still need to train with the claw spell inside the arena before you can use it outside.
You have completed over half of the training needed to use the claw spell outside of the arena.
You are almost ready to use the claw spell outside of the arena.
You're experienced enough to use the claw spell anywhere.
You still need to train with the flame spell inside the arena before you can use it outside.
You have completed over half of the training needed to use the flame spell outside of the arena.
You are almost ready to use the flame spell outside of the arena.
You're experienced enough to use the flame spell anywhere.
Are there any more challenges available?
You still need to learn how to cast all god spells outside of the arena.
I've made a note of the spells you still need to learn in your journal.
You have indeed shown potential,.
However, a wizard of your level wouldn't stand a chance.
I am one of the most powerful mages in existence. But even my power has limitations. There are some beings however that have power exceeding even my own.

characters.name: Chamber guardian
characters.description: Middle-aged male, hushed British accent, reverent and mystical tone. A pale guardian who speaks in whispers about the gods, devoted to his sacred duty in the underground chamber.

characters.name: Kolodion
characters.description: Male, commanding British accent, arrogant and theatrical tone. A powerful shape-shifting battle mage who takes great pride in running his arena, dismissive of lesser wizards but respectful of proven skill.
